SUMMARY: The text provides a clear and detailed explanation of the country's plan to transition to emission-free energy, including the role of nuclear and renewable sources. The text also mentions the start of official negotiations for the fifth unit in Dukovany. Therefore, the veracity of the text can be confirmed as TRUE.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

According to information from the Ministry of Industry and Trade (MIT), a zoning decision on the construction of a new nuclear unit at the Dukovany Nuclear Power Plant should be issued in 2021, a supplier should be selected by the end of 2022, construction should begin in 2029, and the investment should be completed in 2036. There is a risk that in 2040, electricity supplies would not cover consumption for 678 or even up to 3,622 hours a year, and electricity consumption would therefore have to be regulated.

According to the news website Ekolist.cz, a Czech delegation discussed the construction of a new nuclear unit in Dukovany in Brussels on November 20, 2019. It was the first major meeting that precedes the European Union's approval of the completion of the planned new unit at the Dukovany Nuclear Power Plant. We asked René Neděla, Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade for Energy, who also participated in the meeting, whether the Commission had truly appreciated the Czech Republic's move towards a zero-emission economy. He confirmed these words.

The Czech Republic's State Energy Concept (.pdf, p. 44) in the field of energy and climate envisages increasing the share of nuclear energy in primary energy sources to 25–33% (from the current approximately 15%). The share in electricity production should then increase to 58% from the current approximately 34% (p. 9).

The National Action Plan (.pdf, p. 7) for the development of nuclear energy in the Czech Republic from 2015 envisages strengthening the role of nuclear power in electricity generation, namely by building 1-2 new nuclear power plant units and extending the service life of the current Dukovany NPP units.

In relation to renewable sources, the National Plan (.docx, pp. 26–27) states that " The Czech Republic plans to achieve a share of renewable energy sources in gross final consumption of 22% by 2030, which is an increase of 9 percentage points compared to the national target of 13% for 2020. The stated share of 22% corresponds to the requirement to express a national contribution to achieving the binding EU target of 32% by 2030 according to Article 3 of the revised version of Directive 2009/28/EC on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources ( Directive 2018/2001 ) ".

According to the National Plan (.docx, p. 13) of the Czech Republic in the field of energy and climate (also referred to as the climate and energy plan), the share of coal and other solid non-renewable fuels in gross electricity production in 2016 was 50%, the target level in 2040 is 11–21%.

The National Energy and Climate Plan of the Czech Republic (.docx, p. 1) corresponds to the priorities of the European Commission. It was prepared based on the requirement of Regulation (EC) No 2018/1999 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Governance of the Energy Union and Climate Action, the draft of which was presented as part of the legislative package entitled " Clean Energy for All Europeans ". The European Commission published it on 30 November 2016. The National Energy and Climate Plan of the Czech Republic is a revised version of the draft document of the same name, which was taken into account by the Czech Government on 28 January 2019 and which was submitted to the European Commission on 30 January 2019. The European Commission issued a recommendation on this original draft on 18 June 2019.

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: TRUE, SECTION A

SECTION A: I requested from the Ministry of Finance a list of goods and services where VAT was reduced during our period. This (passenger transport, note Demagog.cz) was the only item where we did not do it (we did not vote for a VAT reduction, note Demagog.cz), because transport companies would make money from it without it being reflected in reduced fares for people.
SECTION B: He (Miloš Zeman, note: Demagog.cz) was known to Mr. Sobotka, who first went to the president with the nomination of Mr. Prouza to head the Ministry of Industry and Trade, and when he told Sobotka that he would never appoint Prouza, he came up with another name and did not even propose Prouza. It was the same with my dismissal, which he did not push through, so I resigned myself.
SECTION C: Kateřina Perknerová: But the marginal issue is certainly not the bribery affair at the Ministry of Transport, when former Minister Kremlík did not report the alleged corrupt offer of 1.5 million crowns. SECTION F: We can now talk in principle about the fact that Europe has never borrowed. Here is the Treaty on the European Community. And here Article 311 says: The Union shall provide itself with the means necessary to achieve its objectives and to successfully implement its policies. The budget is financed entirely from its own resources, other revenues are not affected.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: On Friday (March 17, 2023, note: Demagog.cz), information appeared that was not from me, I immediately responded to it, I denied that I would not submit an amendment to this law (regulating the valorization mechanism, note: Demagog.cz) to the government either this week or next week until negotiations with social partners, with the opposition, and until I had completed the proper interdepartmental comment procedure. (...) Yesterday I also wrote this clearly under the account of the Chairwoman Alena Schillerová on Twitter.
SECTION B: So, the tools of assistance (compensation for entrepreneurs, note: Demagog.cz) are shared here today mainly by 3 ministries, that is the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs, for us it is the programs of Antivirus (...), and then we also share the tools of assistance with the Ministry of Industry and Trade and the Ministry of Finance, where the other tools of assistance for entrepreneurs and tradesmen are. 
SECTION C: In the past, there have been judgments where the Constitutional Court stated that, for example, it found some doubts about the legislative process, but did not change the substance, or said that the substance had some defects from the Constitutional Court's perspective, but gave a deadline or said how it would see the correction.
SECTION D: The mechanism (increase in pensions, note: Demagog.cz) is given by law (...), if since the last month taken for the valorization of pensions, which took place from January, which is July last year, inflation increases by more than 5% in total, then pensions are automatically valorized and are valorized according to the level of inflation in the last month in which the cumulative increase of over 5% occurred.

SECTION E: We said that with the pension reform we want to ensure, firstly, that we guarantee decent pensions for the generation of people in their forties, thirties and younger people, also in the future, that there is a fair system, that it is sustainable, that nothing fundamental will change for current pensioners and people of pre-retirement age who are 50 plus.
SECTION F: If you look at the press conference recording (after the government meeting on April 27, note: Demagog.cz), I leaned over to the Prime Minister and asked if it was pure or crude. He himself wasn't entirely sure. I said pure. (...) it was my mistake, I apologized for it, I set it straight.
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

SECTION A: Well, I recommended quite publicly when he was appointed (Minister of Culture Zaorálek, note: Demagog.cz) that he realize that he can have a comfortable life, going from reception to reception, from opening to opening, from festival to festival, but that the Ministry of Culture should take care of dilapidated cultural monuments.
SECTION B: So I have problems with compulsory voting. I'll ignore the stupid argument that the communists introduced it. By the way, you know, right? On the contrary, they abolished Masaryk's law on compulsory voting and formally and only formally, voting was not compulsory. But something else is that under the communists, voting was enforced quite drastically, although not by law.


 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: ...And I was with the admiral who is in charge of Operation Sofia.... We don't have the permission of the Libyan government, we don't have the permission of the UN Security Council, so the admiral is operating in that area, but he can't fight the smugglers on Libyan territory. So what is he doing? He says here that I have destroyed 551 ships and detained 151 migrants. But he will first save the ship and they are not random castaways, according to maritime law. They go there on purpose, yes. And by the way, there are still those non-profit ships waiting there that send signals: come, come, we are waiting. So they have to transport them to the port, the migrants are excited, within two hours, they have already tried it. They will say, well, that's the smuggler, he was on the ship with us. The smugglers then go to prison and then they destroy the ship. So this is really not like a systemic solution. There's a mafia here, they only trade in people and even oil and so on.
SECTION B: And I would like to show the audience that I made a contract with them here before the elections, in October 2017, and I am fulfilling those points. demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

The Ministry of the Interior also commented on the draft Building Act in its analysis (.pdf). In her statement, Minister Dostálová criticizes the estimates of the Ministry of the Interior, which estimated one-time costs at CZK 2.2—31.6 billion (p. 4). The part of securing space for new regional building offices and the planned Supreme Building Office is mainly criticized.

The Ministry of the Interior states in the introduction to the section on Premises (p. 32) that the draft law “(...) currently assumes an optimistic scenario where municipalities and regions will provide the state with their current premises. This expectation is unrealistic; the capacity of municipalities and regions will not be made available, as it would bring extraordinary problems in the area of IT, operation, sharing of services (e.g. the registry office) or working in a different regime (the Act on Civil Servants vs. the Civil Service Act). In the event of delimitation, it will be necessary to provide premises. ” Estimates for securing premises by renting are around CZK 425 million per year. The Ministry further notes that “ (...) it is not possible to solve the delimitation by renting everywhere, as no suitable premises are available at all in certain locations. ” (p. 33)

The chapter dedicated to Construction (pp. 33—34) then states that " The maximalist variant assumes that new premises would be built for all existing officials of building authorities, integrated affected bodies and new service personnel. This includes 13,584 employees in total. Construction expenses would reach at least 25.4 billion crowns in the maximalist variant. " (p. 34). To these costs it would be necessary to add the costs of building archives for storing documentation. These costs are around CZK 3.5 billion. In total, the Ministry of the Interior estimates the construction in the most expensive possible version at CZK 28.9 billion.

Minister Dostálová falsely stated that " (...) the analysis of the Ministry of the Interior does not state that the state currently pays municipalities for the officials who handle construction procedures" . The chapter Financing the Agenda in the analysis deals with this entire issue. (p. 36), which details the current financing of the agenda of building authorities, spatial planning and partly also the affected authorities, which are currently financed through a contribution to the performance of state administration (pursuant to Section 62 of Act No. 128/2000 Coll., on municipalities and Section 29(2) of Act No. 129/2000 Coll., on regions ).

The procedures for determining the amount of the contribution for the performance of state administration for 2020 are listed in the annex to Act No. 355/2019 on the State Budget of the Czech Republic for 2020. The individual contribution amounts for specific municipalities can also be clearly found on the website of the Ministry of the Interior.

The Ministry of the Interior further states (.pdf, p. 38) that the total real costs (including overheads) for the agenda of building authorities and land planning authorities at the municipal and regional levels amount to almost 4.6 billion CZK, of which 4.2 billion CZK are spent on municipalities. However, in reality, only 2.3 billion CZK is spent on the state budget through contributions to municipalities and regions. According to the Ministry of the Interior, the real overhead costs amount to 1.1 billion CZK.

Although the probability of constructing new buildings for all planned employees of new building authorities is unknown, we assess the statement as false, because the analysis of the Ministry of the Interior also addresses the issue of financing building authorities through contributions for the performance of state administration, the amount of which differs from those mentioned in Minister Dostálová's statement.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

The Chamber of Deputies' proposals for granting or awarding state decorations, specifically the nomination for the decoration of Karel Sýs, were voted on May 25, 2018. 14 Pirate deputies voted in favor. However, the Pirates later apologized for voting for the state decoration for Karel Sýs. Deputy Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies Vojtěch Pikal, who admitted his mistake in an interview with iRozhlas.cz, said the following :

" I made the mistake of not studying the personalities enough. I relied on the words of the other deputies from the subcommittee. I thought I would have more time to prepare that day. I did not know that I would be presiding over the Chamber and standing in for Speaker Vondráček (Radek Vondráček from ANO), who suddenly lost his voice."

While Pikal apologizes for not having studied the personalities well enough, Chairman Bartoš talks about the item being put forward and the vote being taken by mistake. According to the shorthand report, the vote was as follows:

PSP Deputy Chairman Vojtěch Pikal: The next proposal is Karel Sýs.
PSP Deputy Chairman Vojtěch Filip: I have started voting number 96 and I am asking who is in favor. Who is against? Thank you.
Voting number 96. Of the 161 deputies present, 108 voted in favor, 25 against. The proposal was adopted.

Pirates chairman Ivan Bartoš commented on the vote for Karel Sýs in an interview as follows :

" Nominations for the award were supposed to be discussed only at the end of the second week, but they were put forward. We had not gone through them. About three names were voted on in the plenary session within one minute, some Pirate MPs noticed the problematic Mr. Sýs and abstained from voting, some followed Vojta Pikal's recommendation."

On October 25, 2018, a vote was also taken on a proposal to permanently include item 117 regarding state awards on the same day, and this proposal was adopted . The shortened period before the vote may therefore have had an impact on its outcome, although we cannot verify whether the Pirates voted "by mistake".

The nomination required 81 MPs to vote in favor. The proposal to nominate Karel Sýs for the state award was approved, with a total of 108 MPs voting in favor, including 14 MPs from the Pirate Party. So even if the Pirate Party MPs had not voted in favor of the proposal, it would still have passed.

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: TRUE, SECTION A

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: Look at how we are increasing pensions. Here we are, the coalition government, we haven't had time yet. And here we are, 2018, 475 crowns and this is the proposal of the minority government of the ANO movement. That, my government, which ruled brilliantly for 205 days, without confidence, but it worked perfectly, is increasing 918 crowns on average per month and another 1,000 crowns for pensioners aged 85. 
SECTION B: ...and I discussed it with him (Wolfgang Schäuble - note: Demagogue) and he always understood us, he saw it at the press conference and said yes, here is the Czech Republic, and the V4 have a different history, they don't have the multicultural model and we don't want it, because the foreigners haven't been integrated in the individual states. 
SECTION C: And I would like to show the audience that I made a contract with them here before the elections, in October 2017, and I am fulfilling those points. I pledged that we would never allow illegal migrants into our territory and that we would never agree to the distribution of migrants according to mandatory quotas. I fulfilled that in six months, we enforced that, yes.
SECTION D: The result is that the chairman of the creditors' committee, the administrator, Mr. Monsport and representatives of the cooperative were also there, so a timetable was agreed upon and that both parties would try to find a new expert who would take into account the investment in time of the people who actually live in those housing units.
SECTION E: And then there is Libya. That is the biggest problem. There is not actually one government there, there are elections coming up, the Libyan guard, which we helped as part of Operation Sofia, is very effective. It is holding the ships, 84% and they didn't have oil in August. So Prime Minister Conte was dealing with oil, because it is a state-owned company, but the government was not able to force them to give the Libyan guard oil so that they could hold the ships.
SECTION F: ...And I was with the admiral who is in charge of Operation Sofia.... We don't have the permission of the Libyan government, we don't have the permission of the UN Security Council, so the admiral is operating in that area, but he can't fight the smugglers on Libyan territory. So what is he doing? He says here that I have destroyed 551 ships and detained 151 migrants. But he will first save the ship and they are not random castaways, according to maritime law. They go there on purpose, yes. And by the way, there are still those non-profit ships waiting there that send signals: come, come, we are waiting. So they have to transport them to the port, the migrants are excited, within two hours, they have already tried it. They will say, well, that's the smuggler, he was on the ship with us. demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: EDITOR: But you had a campaign based on a bus, in which you had pictures of various politicians. IVAN BARTOŠ: There was a funny bus, so everyone was in civilian clothes, there were caricatures and people from the Social Democrats were sitting there. People who were in the government for the KDU-ČSL and then for TOP 09, for example, were sitting there.
SECTION B: So I'll just briefly talk about Lukáš Wagenknecht. Andrej Babiš brought him to finance as a top analyst who fights corruption. And Lukáš Wagenknecht started doing his job, and of course Mr. Babiš didn't like that, so he fired him, he rejected him. Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected for the Pirates in the last election period in the last Senate elections,
SECTION C: I talked about the need to hire a dedicated person to set up communication processes and identify burnout among some politicians. I proposed a budget amendment so that we could pay for such an expert. I promised on our online forum that I would come up with some concrete proposal by Christmas. 
SECTION D: Even in the 2017 pre-election strategy, and in the next one, it is clearly defined. We said that we will not go with undemocratic parties or support a government that will use their votes. So at the moment it is SPD or KSČM. And then we set clear conditions and those conditions of cooperation were there. It will not be a government that will have a majority of YES. There will be no people who have a corrupt past or are in a conflict of interest.
SECTION E: Editor: And Mr. Chairman, do you think that you are already an adult party and that what commentators often say about you, that you are toddlers with a flamethrower, because you burn everything out of the opposition, but you are unable to come to an agreement with anyone, no longer applies to you? Bartoš: That was a famous statement by Mr. Jindřich Šídl, I saw it when someone repeated it in your editorial office in a comment on the forum.
SECTION F: He is on the election committee (Lukáš Wagenknecht, note: Demagog.cz), which elected him himself. There are a lot of people on the election committee. People from the media department, our politicians, regional campaign coordinators, and Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected there as the head who deals with the preparation of the campaign, its financing and coordination.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: In a situation of drought, the spruce tree is ideal for a more humid climate with milder precipitation and cold winters.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question: Please answer TRUE, FALSE or UNKNOWABLE about the text's veracity. In addition write a short summary explaining your answer. If the veracity cannot be determined answer UNKNOWABLE. The first sentence in the response should be TRUE. FALSE. or UNKNOWABLE. eg:UNKNOWABLE.

Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

Simply put, Brabec says in his statement that according to experts, spruce thrives in a wetter climate than a drier one, and that all experts claim this today. This corresponds to our research in the professional literature. We have reviewed several studies, in which, for example, the following formulations are found:

" Wiping and dying are affecting spruce stands of all ages, both artificially established and naturally regenerated. The mechanism of damage is not described in detail, but its basic cause is fluctuations in meteorological conditions, which can be linked to ongoing global climate change. The triggering mechanism of catastrophic damage is recurring periods of drought. " (V. Šrámek and K. Neudertová Hellebrandová, VULHM, p. 305, here )

" Spring and summer drought episodes are demonstrably not only a factor limiting plant growth, but also a significant predisposing stressor. Drought increases sensitivity to some biotic diseases (in particular, a higher incidence of vascular mycoses and diseases of the assimilation apparatus can be expected) and also increases the threat from insect pests. " (P. Čermák, VULHM, p. 9, here )

" The most vulnerable point in the stability of spruce stands growing in the Czech Republic in lower forest vegetation stages (in the 5th to 3rd LVS) is the disruption of its moisture balance with a direct impact on the soil moisture regime and water reserves in the soil. " (P. Hadaš, LDF MZLU, here ).

In the studies we searched for, it is repeatedly stated that drought is a threatening factor for the growth of spruce trees. It is not in our power to determine whether all experts claim this, as Brabec says. However, the fact is that we were unable to find a study that would claim the opposite.

SECTION B:

The Czech government actually rejected the Russian accusation, as Brabec claims, and the Russian ambassador was indeed invited to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. We assess the statement as true despite Brabec's inaccuracy that Minister Stropnický himself negotiated with the Russian ambassador. In reality, it was his deputy Šrámek.

The government opposed the Russian accusation in a statement issued after Prime Minister Babiš's meeting with the directors of the BIS and Military Intelligence. It states, among other things, that:

"No Novichok-type substance has ever been produced, developed or stored in the Czech Republic. This was stated unanimously by both intelligence services in their reports. In the Czech Republic, a program for the protection of troops and the population and the detection of weapons of mass destruction was launched in 2017. As part of this program, the Novichok A-230 substance was to be tested.

In the first phase, the microsynthesis of the substance Novichok A-230 was carried out. During the microsynthesis, the substance was not isolated and this procedure is not considered production or development according to the methodology of the State Office for Nuclear Safety. The resulting product was immediately destroyed. The second phase of the program was not started. The substance of the Novichok A-230 type is different from the substance A-234, which was used in the poisoning of Sergei Skripal in the United Kingdom. The two substances are completely different and have a clearly different chemical structure.

Subsequently, as Brabec claims, the Russian ambassador was indeed invited. The Russian ambassador was informed of the Czech Republic's reservations regarding Russia's accusation of producing Novichok (video from 4:57). However, the meeting with the Russian ambassador was not attended by Minister Stropnický, but by his deputy Šrámek (video from 00:10).

SECTION C:

On 17 December 2018, the government approved a draft law amending Act No. 248/2000 Coll., on the support of regional development, as amended. The draft law was submitted by the Minister for Regional Development Klára Dostálová. Specifically, it is intended to amend Section 18(8) of Act No. 248/2000 Coll., which currently reads as follows: “ The Council for the European Structural and Investment Funds (hereinafter referred to as the “Council”) is hereby established, which is an advisory body to the Government. The Chairman of the Council is the Prime Minister. Its members are representatives of central state administration bodies and representatives of advisory and working bodies of the Government. Details regarding the composition, powers, organization and activities of the Council shall be determined by its statute, which shall be approved by the Government. ”

The proposed amendment (.docx) states: " In Section 18, paragraph 8, second sentence, of Act No. 248/2000 Coll., on the support of regional development, as amended by Act No. 298/2015 Coll. and Act No. 367/2017 Coll., the word ' chairman' is replaced by the word 'member' . "

The amendment's submission report (.docx) also states that, until the amendment enters into force, the Council's Statute will entrust its presidency to the Executive Vice-Chairman of the Council, i.e. the Minister for Regional Development.

The current competences of the Council are defined by the Statute of the Council (.pdf), adopted by the government resolution of 27 April 2016. According to this document, the Council is an advisory body to the government regarding the coordination of assistance provided from the European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF). According to Article 2, point 2. part c), the Council "discusses the substantive interface and connections between programmes co-financed by the ESI Funds with a focus on ensuring synergistic effects".

Or , in the words of Minister Brabec, is this body really " recommends systemic solutions to the government, for example in terms of drawing down European funds, or is responsible for the implementation and the relationship between individual programs and the drawing down of funds for individual program objectives. "

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: TRUE, SECTION B

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: EDITOR: But you had a campaign based on a bus, in which you had pictures of various politicians. IVAN BARTOŠ: There was a funny bus, so everyone was in civilian clothes, there were caricatures and people from the Social Democrats were sitting there. People who were in the government for the KDU-ČSL and then for TOP 09, for example, were sitting there.
SECTION B: EDITOR: He stayed (Jakub Michálek, note: Demagog.cz), but he no longer wanted to run for first vice-chairman. IVAN BARTOŠ: Yes, he did. He announced that sometime in the middle of last year. After all, the focus of his work lies in the parliamentary club, where the chairman of the parliamentary club was elected last week and Jakub Michálek defended him.
SECTION C: The Central Crisis Staff, which is also required by law, was not created at the very beginning. In fact, the government retained a kind of preferential right to announce its decisions to people, politicians, and companies through press conferences, and only then was the Central Crisis Staff created, which was supposed to be a body consisting of experts, which provides the government with the documents, and based on them, the government takes individual measures.
SECTION D: I found something here that you wrote when the case started. Vojtěch Filip, I quote: "Some so-called" - I don't understand why so-called - "municipal politicians have the audacity to do without a mandate from the voters" - which they have - "even foreign policy and go against the government of the Czech Republic. When they get into trouble because of it," - so you admit here that they are in trouble - "they beg for the Czech Police to protect them with taxpayers' money. Their police officers are suddenly not enough for them." You wrote that in response on Twitter.
SECTION E: He is on the election committee (Lukáš Wagenknecht, note: Demagog.cz), which elected him himself. There are a lot of people on the election committee. People from the media department, our politicians, regional campaign coordinators, and Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected there as the head who deals with the preparation of the campaign, its financing and coordination.
SECTION F: The fact that all states would have to agree to apply quotas or some kind of redistribution was not negotiated by Prime Minister Babiš and Mr. Orbán. We simply said that we did not agree with that, the Pirates said the same thing in their statement in 2015, and Sobotka negotiated it sometime in 2017 at a meeting of prime ministers.
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
